data.title: "truck town" demo : sometimes the trailer truck disconnects from its trailer
data.body:
Hi,
With current head.

Into the "Truck town" demo, when you pick up the trailer truck and when you press the up arrow while the truck is falling on the ground for the first time, it happens sometimes that the truck disconnects from its trailer.

With current 1.1 head, it happens about once out of 10 times.
With previous 1.0 version, I remember it happened almost all the times.

data.title: Print()
data.body:
The built-in function print() should insert a space between its arguments.

``` GDScript
print(1,2,3) # 1 2 3 instead of 123
```

data.title: bug in "2d isometric + lighting" demo : the princess is half shaded
data.body:
Hi,
With current head, tested under Windows 8.1, AMD Radeon R4 GPU.

The top of the princess remains in shadows.
Here is a capture :
![godot_20150507_2033_2d_isometric_lighting_demo_princess](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/7522980/ed03cbce-f4f8-11e4-8ea0-539bf77c30f2.jpg)

data.title: window management demo : invalid call. unexisting function 'get_mouse_pos'
data.body:
Hi,
With current head.

The "window management" demo complains about late `get_mouse_pos()`.

data.title: window management demo : FixedSize add an extra border around client rectangle
data.body:
Hi,
With current head. Under Windows 8.1.

If you run the "window management" demo, click on the "FixedSize" button and move the window by dragging its title bar, an extra white or black or randomly colored border will be added around the client rectangle, and the window will be resized to a larger size.
If you disable the "FixedSize" and move the window again, the extra border will be removed, and the window will be resized to a smaller size.

See the capture below :
![godot_20150507_2019_windows_fixedsize](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/7522719/3e243f72-f4f7-11e4-9b42-3e51f0f1ffae.png)

I have not tested with Linux and others.

data.title: RichTextLabel fill alignement wrap bug
data.body:
Hi,

With current head.
The text wrap with fill alignement seems to have a bug that makes the last word of a line to overlap the first word the same line. Here is a photo of the bug caught in flagrante delicto into the "Rich Text Label BBcode" demo :

![godot_20150507_1922_rich_text_label_text_wrap](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/7521738/940b42de-f4f0-11e4-9077-1ac5d243a35a.png)

This must be a romantic bug, because by reading the sentence carefully, you'll notice that the bug makes "Joy" and "Will" "end up fitting the horizontal space entirely ..." over each other. 

The window client size is about 738x600 pixels.

Might be related to #1848.

data.title: oneway platforms propel character over them
data.body:
Hi,

I'm testing all the demos of the current head, and I've just discovered the "one way paltforms" into the "platformer 2d" and into the "kinematic character 2d" demos.

I've found that when you jump too close to a "one way platform", the platform propels you over the top of it.

This behavior surprised me because I was expecting them to have a passive bahavior. Like for instance, if you jump near a table, the table should not propels you over the to of it. The table should become "solid" only once your feet jumped higher than it.
With current bahavior, the table will propels you over the top of it as soon as your head will cross it. 
I think it's a bug or a wrong feature.

Here is an animated GIF showing the beahvior into the 2d platformer demo :

![godot_demo_2d_platformer_20150507_1838](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/7521247/9b06803e-f4ec-11e4-81ce-66cffd8335c6.gif)

data.title: 1.1rc2 - fullscreen game doesn't seem to have focus
data.body: If I launch a game in fullscreen and then try to click something in the game with my mouse, the click actually goes "through" the game, to Godot in the background, bringing it into focus. This is the Linux version, not sure if it does the same on Windows or Mac.

data.title: Godot1.1rc2 breaks layers settings from earlier versions of the engine.
data.body:
Godot1.1.rc2 breaks earlier versions of the Engine of layer's settings for PhysicsBody2D in RigidBody2D properties.
Layers were set correctly to multiple layers and were working as expected in the previous version beta1 as well as 1.1rc1. After opening the project in 1.1.rc2 all rigidbodies2D layers settings had been reset to layer 1. 
How to replicate this bug:
- Create a project in pre 1.1rc2 version of the engine. Using UI create a RigidBody2D node and set it's PhysicsBody2D to layers 1,2,3 and 4 for example. Save the project.
  The project may looks like mine:
  https://github.com/freemanfromgodotengine/my_repository/blob/master/gfx/ProjectinGodot1.1rc1.png
- Open the project in Godot1.1.rc2. 
  Look at The RigidBody2D node, that it has a new subproperty called Collision in PhysicsBody2D property and now Layers is set only to layer 1 and a Mask layer 1 (also new feature not present in previous version of Godot).
  Something like this:
  https://github.com/freemanfromgodotengine/my_repository/blob/master/gfx/ProjectinGodot1.1rc2.png

data.title: Elements of subviewport can draw over editor GUI
data.body:
As the title says:
![godot engine - viewportissue - editor_rendering_issue scn_005](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1196197/7503744/910b39a2-f44d-11e4-9ca9-d71714dda39b.png)

Minimal project that displays the issue:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B2mB5cFTxznfdkJyTURvbzN0UnM/view?usp=sharing

Note: This happens in the current git version as well as for the past week or so - I can't say for before then.

data.title: get_joy_name no implementation on Android
data.body: The get_joy_name inmplementation on android is not proper. I would love to see it working. It would make controllers mappings much easier.

data.title: [1.1rc2.0995a230f6] Input.get_mouse_pos() is missing
data.body:
Hi all,

First, thanks all the contributors and coders of this project for such an amazing engine.
I downloaded 1.1rc2 precompiled binaries and tried to run a project I had that used Input.get_mouse_pos() to provide a trackball effect. The code didn't ran, and while perusing the Input class help on the Godot IDE I noticed that Input.get_mouse_pos() was missing from the class. Is that intended? How should I replace it then? It's a bug? Or an API upgrade?

Thanks in advance,
    Sam "Mizahnyx".
